This is a certified precision platformer classic.

Levels can be done insanely fast, it has a bunch of different characters with different rules as unlockables, achievement cornucopia, regardless if you are a casual who just wanna finish this game for the story, or a hardcore 100% achievement junkie, this game has something for everyone.

oh, and steam doesn't say it but, it also has a level editor.

This game was amazing back in the day, and i had a lot of fun with this game on my youth

I recommend you get this game on a sale, as it goes often for -81% off.

185004560.review:
橫向平台跳躍

閃避障礙平台跳躍到終點

5大關, 每關有20小關左右, 最後有boss戰
方式都不同, 有競速, 追兵逃跑, 背板boss閃避模式

關卡中可以蒐集繃帶, 解鎖角色
角色有不同特性
例如第二隻雞腿速度慢但可以黏牆

容錯率低, 關卡隨難度越來越高
死掉重來很快節奏很好

每關過完會撥放所有死掉的replay和最後成功那次
獨顯出是如何成功的, 很有成就感

元素拆解:
flash美術懷舊感
精準平台跳躍
節奏快
硬派困難
replay機制

主要學習點:

2D平台跳躍的操作能力
	-需要反應閃避危險
	-需要習慣跑跳慣性, 精準微操
	-需要耐心和毅力不畏失敗和重來
	-需要一次次練習
	
缺點:
跳躍重力感有點飄, 需要適應
硬派困難, 讓人感到挫折

184978331.review: An actual hard game back when it released (back when games were hand-holding you all the time) and still is to this day. Buy it on sale.

184946487.review:
This has to be one of the greatest 2D platformers of all time. In this 2010 masterpiece, you play as Meat Boy who has to rescue his girlfriend Bandage Girl who was kidnapped by the notorious Dr. Fetus. While the story doesn't have much in depth or subtly, it makes up for it with it's late 2000s esque humor and charming cutscenes.

But the gameplay is the real deal. Though easy to understand, Super Meat Boy is far from an easy game. As soon as you get to the later levels in the first world, you will have to get better at your platforming skills than what you've ever had before with games like Mario, Sonic or even Rayman!

If you haven't experienced this gem in the platforming genre, play it and develop your skills as much as possible. And heed my warning, you will die. Over and over

184828705.review:
Super Meat Boy isn’t just a game; it’s a test of endurance, skill, and your ability to suppress the urge to hurl your controller. Completing it 100% feels like a true badge of honor, especially with its brutal difficulty and precise platforming. If you’re a fan of old-school, unforgiving games or love a good challenge, it’s hard to beat this indie gem—even if you wish there were a bit more to it.
Whether you’re speedrunning or chasing bandages, Super Meat Boy offers an unforgettable, bite-sized adventure. It’s a short, sweet, and often expletive-filled ride that will stick with you long after the credits roll.
Super Meat Boy has me hooked—I haven't 100% completed it yet, but the challenge keeps pulling me back. It's tough, frustrating, and incredibly rewarding, and I can’t wait to finally conquer it all!

184281403.review:
One of my first games on Steam. Found it through its excellent soundtrack on Spotify. An in-game option lets you switch between the 2010 and 2015 soundtracks. The "Battle of Lil' Slugger (Ch 1 Boss)" that won me over on Spotify was from the former since I got the game in 2014. For under $5, probably during a sale. A really good price given how much game is here.

Took me about 30 hours to get the "The End" (Beat Light World) achievement in version 1.2.5. That's over 100 levels: 5 chapters with 20 levels (or 21, if you count the boss fight). Then there's a 6th chapter with 5 more levels and the big boss fight. Then if you beat each level [i]under its par time[/i], you unlock its harder Dark World counterpart. Another 100 levels. And then, there's another chapter from beating Light World and a Meat World chapter I didn't explore. (There might be more?...) Additionally, players can collect a level's bandages (without dying) to unlock new characters, find hidden portals to unlock and complete secret chambers (without dying!), and beat entire [i]chapters[/i] ([i]without dying![/i]) to get achievements. Although the game's pretty closed-world -- some levels can even fit on one screen -- it feels open because of all the possibilities.

So lots to do, but the game statistics say I'm only halfway through the game. And I have only 16% of the achievements. Definitely felt like achievements though! Would like to replay to get the rest of them, but I know the remaining ones will be [i]much[/i] harder.

The game is [i]easy to learn, difficult to master[/i]. It's [i]pick up and play[/i] with keyboard controls of Left/Right (Arrows) + Jump (Space) + Run (Shift). It surprised me how much variety of movement there was from so few controls! Characters have special abilities, with the default character's being that he can stick to (and, due to gravity, slide off) walls. Story is equally straightforward: Overcome obstacles, dodge enemies, save the princess -- here, Bandage Girl -- from the diabolical Dr Fetus and his EVIL LEGION OF THE UNBORN!... Well no it's just him really, but some of those levels are so tough that it [i]feels[/i] like singlehandedly taking on an army of something! 

No voice acting, but very expressive pantomime animations after defeating bosses. Basic character sprites, making it very performant even on my ol' machine, which is good because as a precision platformer some levels are all about timing. Laid-back, cartoon-like world with a quirky sense of humor that reminded me of games like [i]Conker's Bad Fur Day[/i] or [i]Gex[/i]. Secret levels can hearken back to classics like [i]Mario[/i]. One of the things that makes this game unique from others I've played is that some unlockable players are from other games or franchises, like [i]VVVVVV[/i] and [i]Half-Life[/i]. Once I get all the characters, I'd like to play their games too. This playthrough I primarily used the first character, Meat Boy, only trying the others if I got frustrated, which happened rarely and usually in Dark World.

The game eases players into it with simpler sequences to start. When you finish one, there's a replay of all your session's attempts to solve it. (If I was completely new to a level and solved it in one go, watching myself converge on a solution reminded me of Machine Learning training videos.) All the same, it could still be Try, Try Again for me even early on: If you die, then it's back to the start of the level with you! Beaten levels, on the other hand, are autosaved to the cloud. (There are probably better ways of doing this, but... this playthrough I disconnected from the cloud so I wouldn't mix myself up with a past play attempt.)

You eventually reach a proficiency where you move really fluidly through the challenging and fun puzzles. (I liked the level design in "Chapter 4: Hell" the most.) It's really fun to go back from higher levels and breeze through one that I used to find difficult. When I had trouble with a level, [spoiler]I usually tried to "gun it," going as fast as I possibly could, reasoning that "There [b]has to be[/b] [i]some[/i] way to beat the par time."[/spoiler] So my playstyle probably overused [spoiler]Running[/spoiler] when there were more elegant solutions that didn't. It may have also had something to do with how I finished Light Mode with 6000+ deaths....

I originally wanted to call this one done on getting the "The Real End" achievement for beating Dark Mode. But there's a twist to the end of Light Mode: [spoiler]First beat the boss, then run for the exit. There's a checkpoint between them so if you die in the second part, you still respawn after the first. But I don't think there's a save; it all has to be done in one sitting.[/spoiler] I made it out to be harder than it was when I found that out through experience! If I tried again without setting the game down for a couple of months, I probably could have finished Dark Mode before 2025, which is what drove me to finally finish Light Mode.

Really solid game! Didn't encounter any bugs. Found a "backdoor" once that made a boss fight a little easier, but I think that was there intentionally. If I were to change one thing about the game, it might be to make it so that you could see what's coming up, especially with bosses/levels that had auto-scroll. Camera is usually restricted to being centered on the map, if it fits on one screen, or on the player's character. Then again, "not knowing" is part of the game's challenge. 

Also, if there's a way to rewatch cinematics in the game, I didn't find it -- I beat the game and in my excitement I think I skipped over the closing cinematic! (Oh well, even then it still felt like I finished the game. Plus, they're probably online somewhere.) Looking forward to playing this one more in the future, and maybe its sequel [i]Super Meat Boy Forever[/i].

184090742.review:
有意思的平台跳跃，死法非常丰富。碰到锯齿会死，锯齿类型有：固定型、铰链旋转型、发射型；要进行一定的路线规划，且路线不固定；有无法穿越的墙体或平面；还有触碰后会延迟碎掉的砖块。跳跃、奔跑的距离可以自己控制，还能扒着墙壁无限往上跳，或者蹬着左右墙向上；上述元素通过各种方式排列组合起来，就是这个游戏的内容，还挺有意思。可用的操作比较少，且开始几局有动画图示教程，所以有没有中文对操作没有影响。

虽然部分关卡比较考验操作和反应，但是死了以后能很快重来，类似于蔚蓝，比较爽快。总之，这是个不错的游戏。

183718704.review:
[h1]死ぬほどムズイ！古典的な難しさを誇る2Dアクション[/h1]
彼の名はミートボーイ。バンデージでできた少女バンデージガールとラブラブ。さて、嫌われ者のフィータス博士はそれが気に食わないのでバンデージガールを誘拐しちまった！というわけで助けにいこう！
1ステージは長くとも30秒、ほとんどのステージが15秒程度でクリア可能。ただし、難易度は最初から激高。ぐるぐる回るノコギリが容赦なく攻めてくる。リスポーンは1秒程度で、同じステージで50回以上死ぬことはザラ。いわゆる死にゲーというやつである。
操作方法は移動、ダッシュ、そしてジャンプのみ。運要素を排除した、純粋なスキルのみでチャレンジさせるゲームである。
挙動に少しだけ癖があるが、慣れるとグングンステージをクリアできるようになる。
各ステージにはA+ランクのための目標タイムや、より難しくなったバリエーションのダークワールドもあるので、やりこみ要素にも事欠かない。このゲームの難易度は実績の達成率を見ればある程度はわかる。
これだけ難しいのだから、クリアの達成感も当然大きい。腕に自信があるならぜひともプレイしてほしい一作。

183687553.review: very fun game, would recommend this if you like something with difficulty but also short if you are skilled enough. now i shall torture myself for the 100% achievement.

183686316.review:
[h1] Well Done (...it's a meat joke) [/h1]
Super Meat Boy continues to be one of the most finely-tuned precision platformers to this very day. Coated in the of-it's-time Flash-era vulgarity while still maintaining a bold, distinct visual style while delivering the perfect feedback loop of controller gripping challenge accompanied by satisfaction like no other.

+ Short levels that make for snappy pacing
+ Tight momentum-based controls, especially when climbing/jumping from walls
+ Replays and meat trails add further satisfaction to level completion

- Slippery controls that lead to occassional imprecision

183658961.review:
Некоторые рекомендации:
- Если есть желание пройти на 100%, готовьтесь разбить геймпад.
- Нервы должны быть в порядке
- Пьяным шансов нет играть
- Местами можно сломать глаза
- Готовьтесь страдать

Норм игра, но явно не для всех, всего 6,3% прошедших базовую игру. Чуть больше одного процента кто смог собрать все ачивки.

183535901.review:
Un jeu de plateforme qui donne envie de crier !

Ce jeu est vraiment agréable avec des mécaniques simples qui donnent une sensation parfaite pour un jeu de plateforme. Il y a plein de niveaux, allant des versions faciles aux versions plus complexes.

Pour un jeu de plateforme, il reste difficile à terminer, mais c'est ce qui le rend addictif ! Le jeu est super mignon... jusqu'à ce que tu commences à te frustrer sur les niveaux les plus difficiles. Et les succès ? Ouais, ils sont vraiment diaboliques.
